intro: Myrcianthes edulis, commonly known as araçá-preto, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, dark purple berries. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are elliptical and glossy, while its flowers are small and white or greenish in color. The fruit is edible and has a tart, acidic flavor, often used in traditional medicine and local cuisine.
